turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about PEDOT-TMA.
turn.2: PEDOT-TMA  Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene)-tetramethacrylate or PEDOT-TMA is a p-type conducting polymer based on 3,4-ethylenedioxylthiophene or the EDOT monomer.
turn.3: Is it a type of paint?
turn.4: It is a modification of the PEDOT structure.
turn.5: What are the uses of PEDOT-TMA?
turn.6: Advantages of this polymer relative to PEDOT (or ) are that it is dispersible in organic solvents, and it is non-corrosive.
turn.8: PEDOT-TMA was developed under a contract with the National Science Foundation, and it was first announced publicly on April 12, 2004.
turn.9: What is the trade name of PEDOT-TMA?
turn.10: The trade name for PEDOT-TMA is Oligotron.
turn.11: Is there any other interesting information I should know about PEDOT-TMA?
turn.12: PEDOT-TMA was featured in an article entitled "Next Stretch for Plastic Electronics" that appeared in Scientific American in 2004.
